title: Assemble function of IDA Pro not working properly
content:
I am using the Patch Program option of IDA Pro to edit the assembly of a binary at runtime.

When I enter the following instruction:

mov rax, [rsp + 0x48]

I get an "Invalid operand" error from IDA Pro. I tried changing the above instruction to different variants as shown below:

mov rax, [rsp + 48h]
mov rax, [rsp + 48]

However, it still gives me an error.

This is a valid assembly instruction. I can edit the assembly in other softwares like x64_dbg and it works with the above disassembly.

comments.text: According to stackoverflow.com/questions/24294095/â€¦ The support is very little. Try github.com/keystone-engine/keypatch/blob/master/TUTORIAL.md
Okay, I will try using the KeyStone engine. It's surprising that they do not plan to enhance the Assembler feature in IDA Pro even though they provide it as a feature.
The other workaround is of course to use another debugger like Olly Debugger or x64_dbg, get the opcodes and then use the Patch Program feature of IDA Pro.
